subject: Re: [junit] Junit test
msgSnippet: ... From: Robert Watkins  To:  Sent: Thursday, October 24, 2002 5:23 PM Subject: Re: [junit] Junit test ... I
messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Robert Watkins" <robertdw@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 24, 2002 5:23 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] Junit test


> On Thu, 2002-10-24 at 13:49, Sanjay Mantoor wrote:
> > Please help me for the following issues.
> > How data driven test cases can be done in JUnit without much change
> > in test script?
>
> Put all the test data in an external file. I like XML for this because
> it gives me an easy grouping in the file.
>
> In the test's suite() method, read in the file. For each grouping,
> create a TestCase instance, add the data from the grouping to it, and
> then stick it in the suite().

I have used this technique quite successfully but there is one naging
problem that I have not solved. Typically with data driven testing you have
one test method (or possibly a small set of methods) and each method runs
many tests. The Junit TestCase class uses the method name as the test name
and I would really like to have a unique name for each test (which is easy
to provide in the test data.) Has anyone any ideas on how to address this
issue?
>
> > What way Test results can be moved to log file.
>
> Try the Jakarta Ant project (http://jakarta.apache.org/ant), and the
> <junit> and <junitreport> tasks.
>
> Robert.
>
> --
> "Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
> Robert Watkins email: robertdw@...
>


Jonathan Gossage
